original: EKMAN, Gustaf, Bankdirektör, östafors, f Torrskog, Älvsb l, 21/12 72 av bruksäg J W E o Julia Wallroth, gm Hedvig Larson. Mo-genh.ex Gbg 91, CTL 91—92. Ing v Lesjöfors 93—95, Hallstahammar 95—97, Finspång 97— 99, övering Lesjöfors 99—00, vkst dir Mor-gårdshammars Mek Verkst AB 00—12, Lesjöfors AB 07—11, Storfors Bruks AB 11—19 o AB Gbgs Bk 22—34, vkst dir o Styr.ordf östafors AB sed. 23. Styr.led Morgårdsham-mars Mek Verkst AB sed. 00 (ordf sed. 11), Uddeholms AB sed. 13, Halmst Jvks AB sed. 22, Blombacka AB sed. 30, Degerfors Jvks AB sed. 39. Ldstm Värml l 09, ordf Kroppa s :ns kom.stämma 16—18, d:o Färnebo hds vägstyr 17—19. Led av The Iron and Steel Inst London sed. 04. Led av Sv Tekn.frn. Resor: USA 99, 21 o 23; europ länder uppr ggr. Avtrycket: »Ur Storforsverkcns historia» samt UDDS i tekn o ekon frågor. KVO2kl, KNO; Sv Luftfartfrbs GM, PatrGM. Hobby: Lösande av mek problem.
translated: EKMAN, Gustaf, Bank director, Östafors, born Torrskog, Älvsborg County, on 21/12 1872, son of industrialist J W E and Julia Wallroth, married to Hedvig Larson. Mother deceased. Education: Gothenburg 1891, Agricultural College in Alnarp, 1891-1892. Started working at Lesjöfors, 1893-1895, Hallstahammar, 1895-1897, Finspång, 1897-1899. Became manager at Lesjöfors, 1899-1900, then growth director at Morgårdshammars Mek Verkst AB, 1900-1912, Lesjöfors AB, 1907-1911, Storfors Bruks AB, 1911-1919, and AB Gbgs Bk, 1922-1934, growth director and chairman of the board of Östafors AB since 1923. Board member of Morgårdshammars Mek Verkst AB since 1900 (chairman since 1911), Uddeholms AB since 1913, Halmstad Jvks AB since 1922, Blombacka AB since 1930, Degerfors Jvks AB since 1939. Oldest member of Värmland County Council, 1909, chairman of Kroppa municipal meeting, 1916-1918, chairman of Färnebo rural road authority, 1917-1919. Member of The Iron and Steel Institute in London since 1904. Member of the Swedish Technological Association. Travels: USA in 1899, 1921, and 1923; several European countries. Publications: "From the History of Storfors Works" and contributions on technical and economic issues. Awarded with Commander of the Royal Order of the Polar Star (KVO2kl), Knight of the Order of the North Star (KNO), Honorary Member of the Swedish Aviation Association (GM), Honorary Member of the Scout Association (PatrGM). Hobby: Solving mechanical problems.
